WorkItem.Description:
1. The relative stat valuations for my warrior greatly overvalue stamina with my current gear. Slightly adjusting my stamina up OR down brings the value back in line with the other ratings. 
 
2. The stat valuation for Strength is incorrect. STR has two effects for warriors: melee attack power and Block value. Adding Strength adds Block Value (one per two)  and Attack Power (two per one). 
In the RAWR valuation, Strength is valued at 1.05 Threat, Block Value is valued at 0.88 Mitigation & 0.89 Threat (1.76 total), and Attack Power is valued at 0.70 Threat.
So the value of 1 Strength should be at least as great as (2*AP + 0.5*BV). (0.44 Mit + 1.845 Th) Naturally it would be even higher, due to Vitality, Kings...
 
Repro steps:
Load US/Ravenholdt/Makhand into Rawr v2.3.20. 
Under comparisons, slot:, change Gear>Head to Relative Stat Values.
Observe values of Strength vs. Block Value and Attack Power.
Observe Stamina is valued at 6.85 points, while Agility is 3.94 and Parry Rating is 3.72.
Change the Chest enchant from nothing (oops :) ) to Heavy Borean Armor Kit. 
Observe Stamina is valued at 3.42 points, while Agility is 3.94 and Parry Rating is 3.72.
Change the Chest enchant from the kit back to nothing. 
Stamina returns to 6.85 points.
Change the Head enchant from Arcanum of the Stalwart Protector to nothing. 
Observe Stamina is valued at 3.42 points, while Agility is 3.95 and Parry Rating is 3.73.
WorkItem.Summary: [ProtWarr] Relative Stat Values overvalue stamina; Str not adding to mitigation or survivability

Comments.Message:
It's really easier to download and move and open a file than to just load it from the armory? 
If you say so.

Not easier, but far more useful.    Loading from the armory won't show what settings you are using, what buffs you are using, and my end up with you being in different gear or talent spec than in your Rawr profile.

Exactly right - we need to know the exact configuration with which you're experiencing the problem, so we have the highest chance of observing, reproducing, and identifying the issue.  That's why attaching the character file is repeated so many times in our Posting Guidelines.  :)

As you see, I attached the XML with my original comment. 
Have any of you reproduced the issues?
